patch.description:
Update a check run of a check suite

Following update actions are supported:
* rerun - allows to rerun an already completed check, if the check retry interval is 0
* bypass - applied on a check which has not already been bypassed and whose check suite is not completed yet

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

settings.description: Settings for the approval check configuration.

ApprovalConfig.description: Config to create a new approval.

blockedApprovers.description: Identities which are not allowed to approve.

definitionRef.description: Determines approval check type and its settings.

executionOrder.description: Order in which approvers will be actionable.

values.description: Indicates that the approvers can approve in any order.
Indicates that the approvers can only approve in a sequential order(Order in which they were assigned).

minRequiredApprovers.description: Minimum number of approvers that should approve for the entire approval to be considered approved. Defaults to all.

ApprovalConfigSettings.description: Config to create a new approval.

requesterCannotBeApprover.description: Determines whether check requester can approve the check.

createdBy.description: Identity of person who configured check.

modifiedBy.description: Identity of person who modified the configured check.

modifiedOn.description: Time when configured check was modified.

timeout.description: Timeout in minutes for the check.

definitionRefId.description: Definition Ref Id of the particular check.

resource.description: Resource on which check get configured.

url.description: The URL from which one can fetch the configured check.

allowMultipleConfigurations.description: Flag to allow multiple configurations of a particular check on a resource.

CheckIssue.description: An issue (error, warning) associated with a check configuration.

description.description: Short summary of the check - its name and resource.

detailedMessage.description: A more detailed description of issue.

type.description: The type (error, warning) of the issue.

defaultCheckIssueSettings.description: List of default check issue settings

resourcesWithCheckIssuesList.description: List of resources with check issues

resultUpdates.description: List of check run result updates.

modifiedBy.description: Identity of person who modified check result.
Identity of person who modified check result.

modifiedOn.description: Time of check run's result modification.

status.description: New check run status introduced by result update.

checkRuns.description: List of check runs associated with the given check suite request.

completedDate.description: Completed date of the given check suite request

message.description: Optional message for the given check suite request

status.description: Overall check runs status for the given suite request. This is check suite status

createdOn.description: The create time of check run property.

name.description: The name of the check run property.

value.description: The value of the check run property.

context.description: Evaluation context for the check suite request

id.description: Unique suite id generated by the pipeline orchestrator for the pipeline check runs request on the list of resources Pipeline orchestrator will used this identifier to map the check requests on a stage

action.description: Action that has to be taken for the specified check.

checkId.description: Check id of the check run to be updated.

id.description: Gets or sets check type id.

settings.description: Settings for the generic check configuration.

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

type.description: Gets the node type for this JToken.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

ResourceCheckIssue.description: A check configuration issue (error, warning) associated with a resource.

resource.description: Resource tied to a check configuration issue.

settings.description: Settings for the task check configuration.

displayName.description: Display name of the time zone.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.build_execute: Grants the ability to access build artifacts, including build results, definitions, and requests, and the ability to queue a build, update build properties, and the ability to receive notifications about build events via service hooks.
scopes.vso.pipelineresources_manage: Grants the ability to manage a protected resource or a pipeline's request to use a protected resource: agent pool, environment, queue, repository, secure files, service connection, and variable group
scopes.vso.build: Grants the ability to access build artifacts, including build results, definitions, and requests, and the ability to receive notifications about build events via service hooks.
